Description: Book of the Dead: full colour offering-vignette; red and black ink. Name of owner painted over.
Curator's comments: Published: Art and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt (Japan 1999-2000): No 96 See Quirke, Owners of Funerary Papyri: 114 Published: Piankoff, Wanderings of the Soul (1974): pls.17-33.
To be included in a study of BD spell 168 by Marcus Mueller (Bonn)

See M. Mueller-Roth, F. Weber in R. Lucarelli et al (ed.), Heraugehen am Tage: Gesammelte Schriften zum altaegyptischen Totenbuch (SAT 17; Wiesbaden: Harrassowitz 2012), p. 126-8. Müller-Roth, M. and F. Weber 2010. Neue Quellen des Grüftebuchs (Tb 168). Göttinger Miszellen 226, 63-75.

Mosher, Malcom Jr. 2016. The Book of the Dead, Saite through Ptolemaic periods : a study of traditions evident in versions of texts and vignettes (SPBD Studies), vol. I (BD Spells 1-15) and II (BD Spells 16, 18-30), Charleston.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (134513) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/134513)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1995 Feb-May, Atlanta, Emory University, Reflections of Women in the New Kingdom
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink Pigment Backed: brown paper Checked for loan 1992 Checked for loan to Japan 1998 Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: self adhesive tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: good
